summary: REQ-1 appears implemented via a desktop-only Tailwind arbitrary property on the banner background. REQ-2 appears addressed by removing the desktop max-width constraint on the SearchBar container (mobile still constrained). REQ-3 is partially implemented (stacking count on mobile, smaller styles, smaller mobile link font), but the diff does not show CSS-based no-wrap truncation with ellipsis to prevent wrapping on narrow screens. An unrequested change limits the number of products shown on mobile to 4.

missing_requirements.requirement: On mobile (<768px), truncate long category names to a single line (no wrapping) with an ellipsis to prevent wrapping.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff truncates the string in JS (`substring(0, 22) + '...'`) but does not apply Tailwind/CSS no-wrap + ellipsis truncation utilities (e.g., `truncate` / `whitespace-nowrap` / `overflow-hidden`). Without those, the title can still wrap on narrow screens, violating the 'single line (no wrapping)' acceptance criterion.

hallucinated_features.description: Limit products displayed on mobile to the first 4 items in each category section.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not ask to change how many products are shown per category on mobile; it only requests header layout/typography adjustments.
